meanings.sent1: I will predesignate the meeting time for tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will predesignate the group leaders for the project.
meanings.sent3: Let's predesignate the snack provider for the picnic.
meanings.sent4: She predesignated her successor with great care.
meanings.sent5: The captain predesignated the emergency meeting spot in case of a storm.

meanings.definition: To specify or determine in advance.
meanings.sent1: Please predesignate the route we will take for the hike.
meanings.sent2: The contract will predesignate the payment schedule clearly.
meanings.sent3: I predesignate Fridays as pizza night at our house.
meanings.sent4: The fortune teller seemed to predesignate my future with eerie accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The architect predesignated the exact placement of each room in the house plan.
